pros: Love working at Westside. We are like a small family and we all work so well together.
cons: There are no strong unions available to help us fight for better compensation and staffing etc.

cons: Lengthy hiring process. I got the offer letter but the background checks took 8 days and still needed to be confirmed

pros: Since it’s a full time job you get benefits.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Lauderdale, FL

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Plantation, FL
pros:
They have a good 401k that matches at your same 3%
Just expanded their benefits Nov 2021 to some non traditional coverages such as pain management, acupuncture, etc 
Hold a lot of employee appreciation events aka free food, coffee and massages on shift
Unionized
cons:
The management quality and style varies incredibly from Unit Dir to Unit Dir 
Some of the hospital is very old where some of it is very new
The base wages are low across the board but with education and experience you are better paid than those without 
There isn’t a good work life balance here

review_title: Monitor Tech at Westside Regional Medical
pros: The monitor techs work in a centralized room. HR at WRMC is also very prompt at responding to inquiries.
cons: The centralized room was small as heck.

review_title: In short, LEADERSHIP & UPPER MANAGEMENT SUCKED

pros: I enjoyed working with the night staff. Very team oriented.
cons: Low pay, unsafe assignments, management lived under a rock and showed up if a sentinel event occurred on the unit.

review_title: Great place to work. Friendly staff

pros: They are always professional and care about you
cons: Busy and can always be understaffed

review_title: I love this place!  The CEO is the Bee's Knees
pros: WRMC has had it's share of negative reputation but there is true passion in the leadership team in turning that around. They work tirelessly with patients each and every day to make sure that their experience is positive or less stressful as possible.  It's not an easy job but once you see how much they care about the day to day health of an individual you take pride in being a part of that team.
cons: There are a lot of bad apples that need to be weeded out.   Some doctors are too old to practice and some nurses are too nasty to be allowed to be called caregivers.

job_title: RN Operating Room in Plantation, FL
pros:
The CEO and other executive are very visible and approachable
I work in the OR and I love the team that I work and the Doctor's are pretty great too. Great flexibility with the schedule. Pay is pretty good, but can always be better
cons: Sometimes the pay can be confusing as far as being on call and being called back. The call can be outrageous at times, but it balances out.

review_title: used to love working here but quality has declined in recent years, especially this year
pros: The people I work with, we're really like a family
cons: very short staffed because pay is low

review_title: Not the worst, not the best.
job_title: Registered Nurse in South Florida, FL
pros: Plenty of benefits, good health insurance options. Staff typically works as a team.
cons: Managers and CEOs only care about increasing revenue, not their employees or patients. The hospital was very understaffed and there is a very high turnover rate of employees due to burnout and low salaries.

pros: I didn't see any. After talking to staff there, I feel sorry for them having to go to work there every day. Bad environment for the workers.
cons: HR obviously despises the staff. Staff seems very demoralized over the long term. I had hoped to be able to make a difference in my department, but HR derailed that.

review_title: The big people do not care about the little people. The health insurance is horrible for a hospital.
pros: Willing to hire with no experience.
cons: Horrible health insurance. No room to grow financially.  They do not pay a livable wage.

pros: Was close to home, great staff
cons: I couldn't work the week on call because I had just had a baby
